news.title: Architecture admissions remain dismal in Karnataka, with under 50% of seats filled
news.para: Architecture's popularity is waning among students in Karnataka, with less than half of available seats filled this year. Several colleges face zero intake, prompting concerns about the National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) and its impact on accessibility. Experts suggest the test creates disparities and question its necessity given the low demand.

news.title: Unauthorised constructions under lens after building collapse in Indore
news.para: A building collapse in Indore's Ranipura area, resulting in two fatalities and multiple injuries, has exposed critical lapses in building regulations and safety standards. The three-story structure, initially permitted for ground-plus-one, had unauthorized additions and a neglected, waterlogged basement. This continuous seepage severely weakened the foundation, leading to the tragic collapse in the densely populated area.

news.title: Coimbatore corporation’s model to reuse rainwater gains traction
news.para: Coimbatore Corporation is successfully reusing rainwater. The corporation implemented a unique system at its main office. This system collects and filters rainwater for non-potable uses. Encouraged by the results, the corporation plans to expand the system. It will be implemented in its five zonal offices. This promotes sustainable water management. The system reduces dependency on borewell water.

news.title: Hubballi-Dharwad development body expands its LPA area in twin cities
news.para: The Hubballi-Dharwad Urban Development Authority has expanded its Local Planning Area to 757 square kilometers, incorporating 46 new villages. This expansion aims to curb illegal layouts, promote systematic development, and provide improved infrastructure to the newly included villages. A new master plan for 2041 is being prepared to guide future development in the region.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body wants circle rate hike for Harnandipuram halted, farmers fume
news.para: Farmers in Ghaziabad are protesting against the Ghaziabad Development Authority's (GDA) request to freeze DM circle rates in villages earmarked for the Harnandipuram township. The GDA fears that increased rates will escalate land acquisition costs for the project under the CM Urban Expansion New City Promotion Scheme.

news.title: Joint venture bidding cleared for Visakhapatnam, Vijayawada metro projects
news.para: To encourage wider participation and expedite project completion, AP Metro Rail Corporation permits joint ventures of up to three bidders for the Visakhapatnam and Vijayawada metro rail projects' Phase 1 tenders. However, the corporation has rejected requests to divide the project into smaller packages, aiming to avoid delays and cost overruns.

news.title: Jaipur: JMC-H seals six unsafe buildings, demolishes dangerous portion in drive
news.para: The Jaipur Municipal Corporation–Heritage (JMC-H) initiated a significant campaign against hazardous and crumbling buildings in the Adarsh Nagar zone. Six structures were sealed, and a perilous section of another was torn down to prevent potential accidents.

news.title: Nagpur first in state to grant TDR certificates to owners of encroached land
news.para: Nagpur Municipal Corporation pioneered a scheme in Maharashtra. It distributed TDR certificates to landowners whose lands were occupied by slums. This initiative, guided by CM Devendra Fadnavis, resolves a long-standing issue. Landowners receive compensation, and slum residents gain legal rights. Nineteen plot holders from Babulkheda received certificates. The NMC will reserve land for housing and issue leases to residents.

news.title: Mumbai builder pumps out rainwater, discharges it on road; FIR filed
news.para: The BMC has filed a case against Chandivala Developers for allegedly pumping rainwater from their SRA project site onto SV Road, causing damage to the asphalt surface. The developer's actions, discharging water without proper drainage, led to road deterioration.

news.title: Mumbai: Cabinet nod for redevelopment of 98 housing societies in Andheri Mhada colony
news.para: The Maharashtra cabinet has approved Mhada's redevelopment project for Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Nagar in Andheri (West), encompassing 4,973 flats across 498 plots. Allotted in 1993 under a World Bank project, the redevelopment aims to provide residents with spacious houses and modern amenities. The integrated plan includes green areas, schools, health facilities, and commercial spaces.

news.title: Fraud allegations fly in ₹600 crore Bandra Marina Manor dispute
news.para: A legal battle erupts over the ownership of the Rs 600 crore Marina Manor estate in Bandra, with Marina Manuel Fernandes alleging fraud and forgery against a builder, political leader, and others. She claims they coerced her into signing blank documents and siphoned off funds using a revoked Power of Attorney.

news.title: Former director of Lodha Developers sold land to son's firm without authority: Police tell court
news.para: Rajendra Lodha, former director of Lodha Developers, has been remanded in custody until September 29 following allegations of fraud. Police claim Lodha received millions in cash from land deals and illicitly sold company land, including a plot to his son's firm, causing significant financial losses.

news.title: Parsvnath Developers ropes in Emperor Infratech to complete 113-acre township in Punjab
news.para: Parsvnath Developers has partnered with Emperor Infratech to complete its 113-acre township project in Rajpura, Punjab. Emperor Infratech will manage the development, sales, marketing, and maintenance to expedite project completion and deliver possession to existing customers while selling remaining inventory. Parsvnath aims to focus on executing ongoing projects, having already delivered 68 projects.

news.title: Blackstone's Lumina CloudInfra buys 3.8-acre in Mumbai’s Chandivali for ₹475 crore
news.para: Lumina CloudInfra, backed by Blackstone, has acquired 3.8 acres in Mumbai's Chandivali for ₹475 crore to develop a 60 MW data centre. This project will increase Lumina's Mumbai region capacity to 240 MW, contributing to their total of 600 MW underway across India.

news.title: Zomato Hyperpure leases 2.5 lakh sq ft warehouse in Bhiwandi near Mumbai
news.para: Zomato Hyperpure is expanding its supply chain operations with a new 2.5 lakh sq ft warehouse in Bhiwandi, near Mumbai, under a five-year lease. The lease, commencing in August 2025, involves a monthly rental of Rs 66.21 lakh and aims to bolster Hyperpure's ability to supply fresh ingredients to restaurants and institutional clients in a key consumption hub.

news.title: Suraj Estate Developers launches ₹250 crore project in Mumbai
news.para: Suraj Estate Developer, a Mumbai-based company, has launched Suraj Park View 1. It is a luxury residential project in Dadar with a gross development value of Rs 250 crore. The 29-storey tower has a saleable carpet area of 0.53 lakh sq ft. The project is developed under a redevelopment model. The company's portfolio includes ongoing and upcoming projects.

news.title: Streetlight woes persist as Lucknow civic body gets over 1,000 complaints
news.para: Lucknow residents are facing prolonged issues with faulty or missing streetlights, with over 1,100 complaints pending with the LMC. The worst-affected areas are in Zone 8, especially Fazullaganj and Paper Mill ward. Amid criticism, LMC has reissued a tender worth Rs 10 crore for 16,000 new streetlights in extended areas after controversy over the initial tender process.

news.title: Punjab government orders Mohali development body to acquire land under old policy
news.para: The Punjab government has instructed Greater Mohali Area Development Authority to acquire land using the old policy. This follows farmer protests that led to the withdrawal of a new land pooling policy. Gmada will acquire about 2,600 acres for projects like Aerotropolis and Eco City-3. The aim is to meet development needs and prevent unauthorized colonies.
